metadata.title: CVE-2018-9568 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In sk_clone_lock of sock.c, there is a possible memory corruption due totype confusion. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with noadditional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation. Product: Android. Versions: Android kernel. Android ID:A-113509306. References: Upstream kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9568` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-101-generic - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-lowlatency - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-101-generic - 4.4.0-101.124
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1077.85

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-101.124').
